# The `SSAUpdater` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

Helper class for SSA formation on a set of values defined in multiple blocks.

This is used when code duplication or another unstructured transformation wants to rewrite a set of uses of one value with uses of a set of values.

Definition at line 40 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-h">SSAUpdater.h</a>.

### GetValueInMiddleOfBlock() {#a5b0e45dbba53e985f1b9c532fb5f200b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; SSAUpdater::GetValueInMiddleOfBlock (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; BB)</>}>
Construct SSA form, materializing a value that is live in the middle of the specified block.

<code>GetValueInMiddleOfBlock</code> is the same as <code>GetValueAtEndOfBlock</code> except in one important case: if there is a definition of the rewritten value after the &#39;use&#39; in BB. Consider code like this:


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">   X1 = ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">SomeBB:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">   <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/localizer-cpp/#a428090a453f41a199ef67fc3f2179fbc">use</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">   X2 = ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">   br <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a>, SomeBB, OutBB</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


In this case, there are two values (X1 and X2) added to the AvailableVals set by the client of the rewriter, and those values are both live out of their respective blocks. However, the use of X happens in the <em>middle</em> of a block. Because of this, we need to insert a new PHI node in SomeBB to merge the appropriate values, and this value isn&#39;t live out of the block.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-h/#l00108">108</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-h">SSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-cpp/#l00097">97</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-cpp">SSAUpdater.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### RewriteUse() {#a05c4f6837ee786e83246beeb01e3aa8d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SSAUpdater::RewriteUse (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> &amp; U)</>}>
Rewrite a use of the symbolic value.

This handles PHI nodes, which use their value in the corresponding predecessor. Note that this will not work if the use is supposed to be rewritten to a value defined in the same block as the use, but above it. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> &#39;AddAvailableValue&#39;s added for the use&#39;s block will be considered to be below it.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-h/#l00117">117</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-h">SSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-cpp/#l00187">187</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-cpp">SSAUpdater.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### RewriteUseAfterInsertions() {#a248544705875de8ef1c533827ec73a2e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SSAUpdater::RewriteUseAfterInsertions (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> &amp; U)</>}>
Rewrite a use like <code>RewriteUse</code> but handling in-block definitions.

This version of the method can rewrite uses in the same block as a definition, because it assumes that all uses of a value are below any inserted values.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-h/#l00135">135</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-h">SSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-cpp/#l00247">247</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/ssaupdater-cpp">SSAUpdater.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### UpdateDebugValues() {#aa3e6b78bbdd6959f19055f44fa4b7021}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SSAUpdater::UpdateDebugValues (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I)</>}>
Rewrite debug value intrinsics to conform to a new SSA form.

This will scout out all the debug value intrinsics associated with the instruction. Anything outside of its block will have its value set to the new SSA value if available, and undef if not.

### GetValueAtEndOfBlockInternal() {#a67a394f855b0f4c1fa9bed70e30b98b2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; SSAUpdater::GetValueAtEndOfBlockInternal (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; BB)</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> to see if AvailableVals has an entry for the specified BB and if so, return it.

If not, construct SSA form by first calculating the required placement of PHIs and then inserting new PHIs where needed.

### AV {#a3441b2d33dae53d1ba3b1fb1140beb09}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void&#42; llvm::SSAUpdater::AV = nullptr</>}>
This keeps track of which value to use on a per-block basis.

When we insert PHI nodes, we keep track of them here.
